DOC.detailed_description: This study multi-center , prospective , open-label , randomize , crossover study design gather clinical information subject ' experience use new feature RestoreSensor implantable neurostimulator . Current spinal cord stimulators chronic intractable pain stimulate target nerve along spine use electrical impulse . The stimulation interfere transmission pain signal brain replace painful sensation tingle sensation call paresthesia . Variation intensity neurostimulation body position challenge patient implant conventional spinal cord stimulation system positional change may result overstimulation understimulation . Patients need manually adjust stimulation use patient programmer maintain comfort level position change . The AdaptiveStim feature RestoreSensor neurostimulator develop address challenge improve pain relief and/or convenience relative manual programming adjustment .
DOC.criteria: Meets indication appropriate surgical candidate ( successful SCS screen trial ) implant neurostimulation system spinal cord stimulation ( SCS ) treatment trunk and/or limb pain , per label indication 18 year age old Willing able attend visit comply study protocol Capable use patient programmer recharge neurostimulator ( INS ) , able read answer questionnaire English , without assistance caregiver Males nonpregnant female Has prior implantable SCS neurostimulation system Currently enrol , plan enroll another investigational device drug trial study Has unresolved legal issue relate pain condition would receive neurostimulation Requires cervical placement lead .
